data.title: The definitive progressive rock record guide
data.meta_description: The Progressive Rock Album Of The Day
data.text: 3 Ketih Emerson and Carl Palmer teamed up with Robert Berry and released one album as 3. United Kingdom A.R. & Machines Originally in the Rattles, Achim Reichel ventured into progressive territories with his trademark echo-guitar. Germany Abrahams, Mick Ex- Jethro Tull and Blodwyn Pig guitarist. United Kingdom Acqua Fragile Hailing from Parma, Acqua Fragile were a British-inspired progressive rock band, complete with English-language lyrics. Aided by PFM's management, the band opened for many UK groups touring Italy. Their second album saw... Italy Agents of Mercy Led by Roine Stolt and Nad Sylvan, Agents of Mercy music also feature Jonas Reingold and Lalle Larsson from Karmakanic. Sweden Agitation Free One of Germany's first experimental rock groups, Agitation Free was a part of the scene in Berlin in the late 60s. Members included Michael Hoenig and Chris Franke, Axel Genrich, Lutz Ulbrich and many other notable... Germany Akkerman, Jan Focus guitarist, won many accolades in Britain during the early 70s. Netherlands Albrighton, Roye Nektar guitarist and vocalist has released just one solo record. United Kingdom Allen, Daevid aka Dingo Virgin, El Alien, Bert Camembert, Zero, etc... Daevid Allen is one of the most longstanding, colorful and prolific artists of the progressive era. Leaving his native Australia in the early 1960s, Allen had... Australia Alphataurus Relatively unknown Italian band released one eponymous album of excellent quality before dissolving. Second release is incomplete (no vocals). Italy Amon Düül The original "Wohngemeinschaft" from Munich, Amon Düül's mixture of politics and music were born straight out of the 60s. Musically, however, it's unessential listening. All releases were culled from recording sessions... Germany Amon Düül (UK) Led by John Weinzerl and Dave Anderson, the band's name was of some dubious origin. United Kingdom Amon Düül II Led by Chris Karrer, the musical half of the Munich commune hippie band of the same name; a little to rough around the edges for prog standards, but most certainly not to be overlooked; Amon Düül II are Germany's finest... Germany Anderson, Ian Oddly enough, Ian Anderson's lone solo album highlights early 80s keyboard technology. United Kingdom Anderson, Jon Following his departure from Yes in 1979, Jon Anderson enjoyed a degree of success in the UK with a string of solo releases and a good touring band, "The New Life Orchestra". His concurrent work with Greek keyboardist... United Kingdom Andromeda John Du Cann's band prior to his joining Atomic Rooster. Also of note are the one-off Five Day Week Straw People and The Attack. United Kingdom Ange Le plus grand groupe de rock francais, and we'll pretty much agree. Ange's completely original and unique take on the "progressif" is most definitely and definitively French. Led by vocalist Christian Decamps. France Änglagård Almost single-handedly, Anglagard reinvigorated the prog rock genre with their 1992 debut Hybris. Sweden Anthony Phillips & Harry Williamson Phillips and Williamson teamed up in 1976 to score the soundtrack to Tarka the Otter, a novel written by Henry Williamson, Harry's father. United Kingdom Anyone's Daughter Progressive rock band founded in 1972 in Stuttgart, Germany by Uwe Karpa und Matthias Ulmer. Germany Aphrodite's Child Led by Demis Roussos, Aphrodite's Child found success throughout Europe with pop singles, eventually residing in Paris, France. Their legacy however is the posthumously released psychedelic masterpiece, 666, and its... Greece Area Self proclaimed "International POPular Group", Area were Italy's finest fusion band, featuring the unique vocals talents of Demetrio Stratos. Italy Argent Rod Argent and Russ Ballard's 70s rock outfit. United Kingdom Argent, Rod Keyboardist and composer of the Zombies and Argent. United Kingdom Art Bears Post-Henry Cow project from Fred Frith and Chris Cutler, featuring the insufferable vocals of Dagmar Krause. United Kingdom Arthur Brown Arthur & Vincent Crane Believe it or not, but Klaus Schulze is responsible for this! United Kingdom Arti & Mestieri Led by drummer Furio Chirico (formerly of The Trip), keyboardist Beppe Crovella, and composer Gigi Venegoni, Arti e Mestieri were one of Italy's finest progressive rock bands. Their debut album Tilt is an undisputed... Italy Ash Ra Tempel One of the earliest krautrock groups, featuring guitarist Manuel Göttsching, Klaus Schulze on drums and bassist Hartmut Enke. Think album side-long psychedelic jams of the highest order... Germany Ashra Led by guitarist Manuel Göttsching, who previously led Ash Ra Tempel. Germany Asia Asia marked a new dawn in the era of progressive music. United Kingdom Atoll French symphonic band, well-regarded albums. France Atomic Rooster Always driven by Vincent Crane's keyboards, Atomic Rooster road a firm line between the hard and progressive. Crane and drummer Carl Palmer, first together in Arthur Brown's band, made one album before Palmer was off to... United Kingdom Audience Combining the talents of Howard Werth on vocals and acoustic guitar and Keith Gemmell on saxophone, with the rhythm section of Trevor Williams and Tony Connor, Audience's second album (first on Charisma) will appeal to... United Kingdom Auger, Brian & The Trinity One of London's original rock organists, Brian Auger's early career included work with Steampacket and Julie Driscoll. United Kingdom Axis Point Charlie Whitney's post-Streetwalkers group, with Eddie Hardin and Charlie McCraken. United Kingdom Ayers, Kevin The Original Mr. Cool. An original on the Canterbury Scene, Kevin Ayers spent the 60s with Wilde Flowers and Soft Machine before retiring to the comforts of Deià, Mallorca. Coaxed away by Peter Jenner, Ayers recorded a... United Kingdom Babylon United States Badger Ex Yes members featured in the first incarnation of the band. Their debut album, recorded live while supporting Yes, has a slight christian slant to the lyrics. Second album saw the arrival of Jackie Lomax. Recorded in... United Kingdom Bakerloo Originally called the Bakerloo Blues Line, Dave "Clem" Clempson, Terry Poole and Keith Baker released one album of blues rock for Harvest. Also of note was their "Drivin' Bachwards", an earlier version of Bach's Bourree... United Kingdom Balletto di Bronzo, Il Led by Gianni Leone, the band's second album stands as one of the finest and darkest prog rock albums from Italy. Italy Banco Del Mutuo Soccorso One of the great (and original) Italian prog bands, propelled by the keyboards of brothers Noncenzi and the tenor voice of Di Giacomo. Italy Banks, Peter Original guitarist for Yes United Kingdom Banks, Tony Genesis keyboardist and composer United Kingdom Beatles, The The most influential band ever? The very essence of "progress" in rock music is charted with The Beatles musical journey. In early 1966, the Fab Four left Beatlemania and three minute pop songs for the inner space of... United Kingdom Bedford, David Classical music composer best known for his work with Kevin Ayers and Mike Oldfield. United Kingdom
